page.title: 01Introduction to Coleshill.
page.content: Coleshill,a town with a population of approx.9000 is a linear town between Coventry and Birmingham on the river Cole,the river Blythe flowing to the east.An ancient town,the Romans built on Grimstock Hill and it was the important centre of the Hemlingford Hundred.King John granted a market charter in 1206 and a market is held in 1985.The magnificent church dominates the surrounding countryside and has many fine features including the Digby tombs,the Lords of the manor .There are many fine buildings in the town dating from the 13C.The greatest period of prosperity in the 18C resulted in fine houses in the High St.and Market Place,now Church Hill.In 1985 it is on junction 4 of the M6, close to B'ham airport, the National Exhibition Centre and National Agricultural Centre.
